title: Is the telegraph a telephone? - Quora

response.answer_text: The key here is the root meaning of each word, originally from Greek: tele meaning ‘distant’, graph meaning ‘writing’ and phone meaning ‘sound’. So the answer is no, although the original means of transmission by electrical signals through wire was the same, the (later) telephone was more sophisticated and capable of a much greater rate of transmission of information.

Although they may be using the same networks, and can be transmitted by wire, cable, or as a radio signal, the simple answer is no. The telegraph predates the telephone, but the main difference is that you talk into a telephone, whereas a telegraph message is sent in a code. E.g morse.
